subtasks: Selecting healthy guava sprouts.
Planting the sprouts with soil, ensuring complete attachment.
Watering the planted sprouts using drip irrigation.
Spacing the sprouts to 1-1.5 meters apart.

tasks.task: Irrigating and maintaining the guava trees.
subtasks: Installing a drip irrigation system.
Filtering irrigation water to remove impurities.
Adding nutrients to the irrigation water.
Regularly checking and maintaining the irrigation system.

tasks.task: Trimming guava trees for optimal fruit development.
subtasks: Trimming excess branches when trees are four months old.
Pruning grass around the trees.
Directing tree nutrients towards fruit by cutting branch tops.
Periodically pruning branches to maintain tree health.

tasks.task: Protecting guava fruit during the waiting period.
subtasks: Wrapping guavas in nylon bags.
Monitoring and regulating the environment inside the bags.
Pruning branches post-wrapping to direct nutrients to fruit.
Checking the sweetness levels of the fruits.
Harvesting guavas with scissors to avoid bruising.
Arranging harvested guavas in trays.
Washing the harvested fruits in clean water.
Placing the washed guavas on trays.
Wrapping the trays with shock-absorbing foam.
Transporting the packaged guavas to distribution centers.
